bug.summary: GaussNoise does not work correctly on small images
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Hi Vladimir! The error lies in the fact that the GaussNoise method does not work correctly on small pictures (i tested 128*64), since the argument var requires an integer value: GaussNoise(var_limit=(1, 1), always_apply=False, p=1) <denchmark-link:https://files.slack.com/files-pri/T040HKJE3-FGMFW433R/image.png>https://files.slack.com/files-pri/T040HKJE3-FGMFW433R/image.png</denchmark-link>
It helped for me: <denchmark-code>def add_gaussian_noise(image_in, noise_sigma): temp_image = np.float64(np.copy(image_in))
h = temp_image.shape[0] w = temp_image.shape[1] noise = np.random.randn(h, w) * noise_sigma
noisy_image = np.zeros(temp_image.shape, np.float64) if len(temp_image.shape) == 2: noisy_image = temp_image + noise else: noisy_image[:,:,0] = temp_image[:,:,0] + noise noisy_image[:,:,1] = temp_image[:,:,1] + noise noisy_image[:,:,2] = temp_image[:,:,2] + noise
return noisy_image </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: looks like it does not work for float32 but works correctly for uint8
